description._content: Title: Denver & Rio Grande depot. Manitou. Creator: Jackson, William Henry, 1843-1942 Date: ca. 1882-1897 Part Of: Lantern slides of Mexico, California and Colorado Description: After his employment as official photographer of the USGS ended in 1878, W.H. Jackson opened a commercial studio in Denver. His commissions included advertising photographs for railroad companies, such as Denver and Rio Grande. This photograph shows a Denver and Rio Grande depot in Manitou, Colorado. Physical Description: 1 slide: lantern; 8.3 x 10 cm. Form/Genre: Glass transparencies; Lantern slides File: ag1984_0301_1424_opt.jpg Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/wes,435 View U.S. West: Photographs, Manuscripts, and Imprints at: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/wes
